Ten years after it was signed, what has the Paris Agreement on climate change achieved?
subhead: The fate of the agreement will take center stage at the 30th United Nations Climate Change Conference, which opens on Thursday in Brazil with a summit of heads of state. Signed in 2015, the treaty has slowed global warming, but has not limited it to a sustainable level.

Mexico's President Sheinbaum calls for tougher sexual harassment laws after attack
subhead: President Claudia Sheinbaum was attacked while greeting supporters near the presidential palace on Tuesday. A drunken man approached the leader and proceeded to grope her, drawing attention to the country's troubling record on women's safety.

title: In Indonesia, a free meals program leaves a bitter taste
subhead: The initiative, launched by the presidency at the start of the year to address stunted growth among schoolchildren, has turned into a fiasco. Thousands of pupils and students have suffered from food poisoning, as complaints continue to pour in.

title: Olivier Rousteing leaves Balmain after 14 years of successful collaboration
subhead: The French designer and the Parisian fashion house ended their partnership on Wednesday after several months of speculation.

title: Celso Amorim, Lula's influential special adviser
subhead: At 83, Brazil's most seasoned and renowned diplomat continues to steer the country's foreign policy. We look back at the career of this respected 'sherpa,' who now criticizes Western countries while sparing Russia.

subhead: This ethnic and religious minority now numbers just 4,000 members and faces intrusive tourism and the degradation of their environment, which is essential to their survival.

title: The negotiations that led to the release of two French hostages in Iran
subhead: The two union activists, Cécile Kohler and Jacques Paris, were granted conditional release after over three years in prison and allowed to enter France's embassy in Tehran, but are still banned from leaving the country.
byline: Elise Vincent,  Claire Gatinois and  Philippe Ricard

title: 'There's almost no water left': On the front lines of climate change in southern France
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (6/6). Persistent drought, record temperatures, wildfires: Faced with the most acute effects of global warming, residents of the Aude department in southern France are looking for ways to keep their region alive.
